required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neoadjuvant Cetuximab + Chemotherapy Combined With Short-course Radiotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Neoadjuvant Cetuximab + Chemotherapy Combined With Short-course Radiotherapy for RAS Wild-type Locally Advanced Rectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Prospectively Investigate the effectiveness and safety of neoadjuvant cetuximab + chemotherapy (mFOLFOX6) combined with short-course radiotherapy (25Gy/5Fx) for RAS wild-type locally advanced rectal cancer

secondary_outcome.description: Refers to the pathological examination of primary tumors and lymph node surgical specimens without residual infiltrating tumor cells (ypT0N0, TRG 0)

Refers to the probability of not finding local recurrence of tumor within 2 years，including anastomotic recurrence confirmed by pathological biopsy, pelvic tumor recurrence confirmed by imaging examination, or suspected pelvic recurrence with CEA exceeding the normal upper limit.

secondary_outcome.measure: 2-year metastasis-free rate 2-year distant metastasis free rate
secondary_outcome.description: Refers to the probability of no distant metastasis within 2 years
Refers to the time from the start of treatment to death due to any cause.
Refers to the time from the start of treatment to recurrence.

intervention.description: cetuximab 500mg/m2 d1 Oxaliplatin 85mg/m2 d1 Calcium Folinate 400mg/m2 d1 5-fluorouridine 400mg/m2 d1 5-fluorouridine 2400mg/m2 46h q2w, 6 cycles
25Gy/5Fx short-course radiotherapy between the forth and the fifth cycle of cetuximab+mFOLFOX6

study_pop.textblock: Patients aged 18 to 75 years with locally advanced rectal cancer, regardless of gender, ethnicity and regional distribution, were involved in this study. Patients were required to be in good health and have sufficient organ function and bone marrow function.
